byline.original: By SUSAN J. BEHRENS and HOLLY EPSTEIN OJALVO

abstract: Analyzing words that function as both nouns and verbs in the pages of The New York Times.
snippet: Analyzing words that function as both nouns and verbs in the pages of The New York Times.
lead_paragraph: Overview | In this lesson, students play with words that can function either as nouns or verbs, depending on context. They then find and parse "double duty" words in New York Times articles. Advanced students compare these instances with information in dictionaries and frequency count lists, showing which usage occurs more frequently in English.

headline.main: When Is a Noun a Verb? Examining 'Double Duty' Words
